titlestmt.subtitle: An Inventory
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Cameron Miles.

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-11-05T09:30-0500

repository.corpname: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries

did.abstract: The collection contains newspapers, fliers, realia and similar materials associated with living in wartime Britain.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Barabara Rosen, a member of the University of Connecticut faculty, grew up in Great Britain.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains fliers, realia (coins), notes, manuscripts, book, publications, newspaper clippings, identification cards, medical card, ration books, national savings certificates, and similar materials associated with living in wartime Britain as well as two books by Elsie Cooper.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged as received.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the newspaper is restricted due to their fragile condition.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Copyright Information
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from both the University of Connecticut Libraries and the owner(s) of the copyright.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to the University, its history, administration, faculty, staff and students. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the reference desk.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#], Barbara Rosen Papers. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials in this collection were donated by Dr. Rosen in 2001 and 2003.

did.unittitle: Clippings, fliers, realia (coins), notes, manuscripts, book, publications, newspaper clippings, identification cards, medical card, ration books, national savings certificates

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: [Subjects include: personal documents related in World War I and II era in Great Britain.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: [Subjects include: Great Britain during World War I and II era.]
